content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    code_block_pattern = r"^```julia\n([\s\S]*?)^```\n"m

    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Iterate over each match of the pattern in the markdown document
    for match in eachmatch(code_block_pattern, md)
        # Get the content of the code block
        code_block = match.captures[1]

        # Remove the code fences (```julia and ```) from the start and end of the block
        code_block = replace(code_block, r"^```julia\n" => "")
        code_block = replace(code_block, r"^```\n" => "")

        # If there's more than one code block, join them with a newline
        if !isempty(extracted_code)
            extracted_code *= "\n"
        end

        # Append the current code block to the extracted code string
        extracted_code *= code_block
    end

    return extracted_code
end
```
